column4: how can I install ubuntu-amd64.iso to my thumbdrive in ubuntu-i386 ?
I recommend you don't use ubuntu-amd64.iso, I recommend you download the ubuntu installer meant for thumb drives and memory sticks
what u mean?
.iso files are CD images, meant to burn to a CD.
where do i find the other iso for thumb drive then?
btw I'm installing it to a pc just via thumb drive... if that matters?
stand by.  It won't be a .iso file.
mgolisch , the usb startdisk creator in ubuntu wont solve putting the iso to my usb drive for me?
this will make it easy:  http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/download-netbook
but i dont want the netbook remix version
I understand that.  Follow the link the other fellow gave you for creating a boot disk.
an iso file will ONLY allow you to burn it to a CD, not to a USB device.  It's not quite as easy getting it to a USB Device, but it *IS* possible
well it seems very easy using the ubuntu tool by going to "System>Admin>Usb startup disk creator" ...
that's true, but that won't have the USB installer on it
whats the usb installer?
repeat that, fwaokda?  I don't understand what you're asking.
you said "...that won't have the USB installer on it" I asked what is the "USB installer" your talking about.
sorry, I meant that won't have the Ubuntu Installer.  I made a typo, I apologize
hmm ok
thanks
you're welcome
